statements: UPDATE financial_kpis SET value = 100 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE financial_kpis SET value = 200 WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE financial_kpis SET value = 150 WHERE id = 3;
UPDATE financial_kpis SET kpi_name = 'Revenue', value = 1000 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE financial_kpis SET value = value * 1.1 WHERE date >= '2022-01-01';
UPDATE financial_kpis SET value = value * 0.9 WHERE kpi_name = 'Expenses';
UPDATE financial_kpis SET value = 100 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE performance_metrics SET metric_value = 50 WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE financial_kpis SET date = '2022-10-01' WHERE id = 3;
UPDATE financial_kpis SET value = value * 1.1 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE performance_metrics SET metric_value = metric_value + 10 WHERE category = 'Sales';
UPDATE financial_kpis SET value = value + (SELECT metric_value FROM performance_metrics WHERE category = 'Revenue') WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE financial_metrics SET value = 1200.50 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE kpi_metrics SET actual = 500.75, variance = target - 500.75 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE performance_metrics SET score = 95.25 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE financial_metrics SET value = value + 100 WHERE name = 'Revenue'
UPDATE kpi_metrics SET variance = actual - target WHERE date = '2022-01-31'
UPDATE performance_metrics SET score = 4.5 WHERE employee_id = 100 AND metric_name = 'Productivity'
UPDATE financial_metrics SET metric_value = 1000.50 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE performance_metrics SET metric_value = 75.25 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE users SET email = 'newemail@example.com' WHERE user_id = 1;
UPDATE financial_metrics SET metric_value = 5000.00 WHERE metric_name = 'revenue';
UPDATE performance_metrics SET metric_value = 0.95 WHERE metric_name = 'customer_satisfaction';
